resources.string: The vision of University Programs is to be the central location for all on-campus programming. We will share our resources with other campus departments, student organizations and community partners to assist them in the planning, promotion and implementation of their events. In addition, we will engage students through programs to play a more active role in their experience and education at the Capstone.

University Programs is the student-led, student-driven board, which aims to provide University of Alabama students with a variety of events that enhance the overall student experience. We are committed to supporting the overall academic, research and service mission of The University of Alabama and the Ferguson Center Student Union by providing quality collaborative programming that promotes lifelong learning and allows all students to find a place of involvement and importance.

Home: Birmingham, AL
Major: Sports Management
Year: Graduate
Position: Graduate Assistant

My Job: I have been with University Programs since September 2012 working as an event programmer and communications specialist. Upon receiving my Bachelor\'s in public relations from the University of Alabama in August 2013, I am continuing working with UP as a graduate assistant. Currently, I oversee the event programmers and provide them with advice and support. It is my goal to ensure that all programs are fully developed and implemented so we can provide the Capstone with exceptional programs year round.\n\nFun Fact: I went bungee jumping over spring break.

Home: Millbrook, AL
Major: Public Administration
Year: Graduate
Position: Graduate Assistant

My Job: I co-teach the RHM Practicum course. I am responsible for the overall execution of their events as well as overseeing the marketing strategies that are put forth. This position allows me the opportunity to lead students within the University of Alabama while also learning the fundamental skills needed for my future career. I also assist in other areas within our office when needed. I consider my position to be challenging; however, I truly enjoy all of the challenges I face everyday. University Programs is a family, and I am grateful to each person that makes up our office.\n\nFun Fact: I have a gorgeous puppy named after a Starbuck coffee (Mocha Latte).

Home: Peoria, IL
Major: Advertising/Public Relations
Year: Graduate
Position: Graduate Assistant

My Job: I teach the students of the APR 381 Practicum. I advise them in every aspect of the practicum course. Under my supervision, the APR 381 students work closely with the RHM 385 practicum students to gain practical work experience by planning events and implementing promotional efforts. With my guidance, students are able to explore their chosen major, while also helping them clarify and evaluate academic and career goals.\n\nFun Fact: I broke both of my wrists during my senior year of high school while playing a game of dodgeball.

Home: New Orleans, LA
Major: Public Relations
Minor: Civic Engagement and Leadership
Year: Senior
Position: Event Programmer

My Job: I love being involved in student life, and I can do accomplish this by providing the campus with student interests. Working at UP gives a fantastic opportunity for me to program events for students. I have my hand in all aspects of UP from movie series to logistics.\n\nFun Fact: I\'m a member of the Theta Sigma Chapter of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority Inc. and a cadet in Air Force ROTC.

Home: Atlanta, GA
Major: American Studies/ Communication studies
Minor: General Business
Year: Junior
Position: Event Programmer

My Job: I currently serve as an event programmer with University Programs. Here I have the opportunity to logistically plan and implement events that specifically cater to the student body\'s needs such as the On The Town series. I thoroughly enjoy working in a team environment that challenges my creative and critical thinking skills while also gaining valuable professional experience and networking opportunities.\n\nFun Fact: I am obsessed with Beyonce.

Home: Hangzhou, China
Major: Marketing/ Advertising
Year: Junior
Position: Event Programmer

My Job: I have been with University Programs since January 2013 and now work as the director of International Expressions series events. International Expressions is a monthly event that highlights diverse cultures around the world to promote cultural exchange and inclusiveness on campus. These special events are created to give students the opportunity to learn about the traditions, customs, arts and values of different countries. This is done through interactive activities and performances such as food tasting, traditional dance, craft-making etc. For the international community, International Expressions is important because it provides a platform for various cultures, on UA campus and in the Tuscaloosa community, to be represented and shared with other students, faculty and local families.\n\nFun Fact: Candice is not my real name.

Home: Austin, TX
Major: Industrial Psychology
Minor: Computer Science
Year: Senior
Position: Event Programmer

My Job: while I have only been with the University Programs team for a short time, I have learned a great deal about my campus, colleagues and community. As an event programmer I have been presented with opportunities to exercise my leadership skills as well as showcase my passion for people. During my time here at the Capstone, it is my goal to leave a legacy and University Programs is the place to do just that.\n\nFun Fact: I am one of six girls.

Home: Chicago, IL
Major: Telecommunication and Film
Year: Graduate
Position: Intern

My Job: Reginald serves as an Intern at University Programs, as well as a Graduate Teaching Assistant and Research Assistant for the Telecommunication and Film department. As an Intern, Reginald has worked in a team environment to plan, organize, and execute a variety of events. Reginald states, "UP has provided me with a great opportunity to further obtain working knowledge and real world experience in, among others things, project management, event coordination, logistics, marketing, and public relations."\n\nFun Fact: In addition to being a fan of Bama athletics, Reginald is also a fan of several professional sporting teams, including the Chicago Bears and Miami Heat.

Home: Slapout,AL
Major: Public Relations
Year: Senior
Position: Communications Team

My Job: I love designing various flyers and invitations for the events at UP, and I am also responsible for writing press releases and promoting events through Constant Contact. One of my favorite responsibilities is updating UP\'s social media, and I am especially fond of brainstorming and providing new ideas to increase followers and awareness.\n\nFun Fact: I\'m a UA Cheerleader!

Home: Grove, AL
Major: Law
Year: 2nd year Law student
Position: Intern

My Job: I recruit performers, speakers and volunteers to perform at the University of Alabama. During the recruitment process, I research the contract history of the individual. Next, I review and negotiate contract.\n\nFun Fact: I enjoy reading astrology.

700 University Boulevard
Capstone Medical Building - Room 236
Box 870292
Tuscaloosa, AL 35487
